laboratory_examinations.findings: A 4-cm osteolytic lesion in the right frontoparietal skull, hyperdense epidural fluid collection, and a low-density lesion within the right frontal lobe surrounded by vasogenic edema.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent CT scan three days after surgery showed complete resection of the lesion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reactive squamous metaplasia with submucosal proliferation of macrophages; Michaelisâ€“Guttmann bodies consistent with malacoplakia.
No recurrence of the disease and repair of the cranial defect with a custom-fabricated implant.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient clinically stable without evidence of disease recurrence.
